H0.text: Hydrocarbons are the long chains that free fatty acids, which are carboxylic acids, contain.

H1.text: Vapors are long chains contained in free fatty acids, which are carboxylic acids.

H2.text: Lipds are the long chains contained in free fatty acids, which are carboxylic acids.

H3.text: Particles are the long chains that free fatty acids, which are carboxylic acids, contain.

A4.text: Very long chain fatty acids (VLCFAs) are fatty acids with aliphatic tails of 22 or more carbons.

A5.text: Short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs) are fatty acids with aliphatic tails of five or fewer carbons (e.g. butyric acid).

A6.text: Most naturally occurring fatty acids have an unbranched chain of carbon atoms, with a carboxyl group (–COOH) at one end, and a methyl group (–CH3) at the other end.
